file_content.text: Major! Lieutenant Mai--I'm General Garza's new assistant. It's a real honor to meet you.
It's good to meet you too, Lieutenant. Could I see the general?
Likewise.
General Garza never said anything about a pretty new assistant.
[Flirt] Really?
Oh, uh, thank you very much, sir. She just appointed me--I'm very excited to be here.
I never knew General Garza even had an assistant.
New assistant?
Yes, she told me she usually prefers not to have one. But I suppose circumstances have changed.
The general had to leave to deal with an urgent situation on Corellia. If you'd like, I can connect you with her via holo.
I'm here to see Garza. Where is she?
Don't waste my time.
I'm afraid General Garza had to leave--an urgent situation on Corellia. I can put you through to her via holo, if you like.
That would be great, Lieutenant.
Sounds good.
One moment, please.
We'll get to Garza in a minute. I want to know more about you.
[Flirt] No need to rush.
Me, sir? I'm nobody special--just an officer from Logistics. I've never done anything interesting like you.
Want to wrap this up, sir? We've still got that war going on.
Are you quite done, sir?
Sir, given the circumstances, wouldn't it be best to leave the small talk for later?
It's true, my friend--the major has accomplished some incredible things. He is truly a beacon of Republic heroism!
That's what I've heard. You're practically a legend, Major. Here, let me get General Garza for you.
You don't even know the half of it, babe. You should get him to take you out for a drink, he could tell you some pretty crazy stories.
Oh, I--well, that would be an honor, of course, but I wouldn't... here, let me just get General Garza for you.
Blah, blah. Flirt when I don't have to be around for it.
I'm sorry--I'll get General Garza on the holo. Just a second.
With time, even the smallest act can have amazing consequences. Never believe that your contributions are unimportant.
Oh, thank you. That's very nice of you to say. Here, let me get the general for you.
I'd love to talk more, but I think I'd better put you straight through to the general. One second.
What's this "urgent situation" on Corellia?
Corellia?
I should let General Garza explain. One moment, please.
Sometime today would be good.
Make it fast.
I'm sorry--one moment, please.
Ah. Major. You've truly crossed the line this time. I don't even know where to begin.
What made you think you could gun down a Senator in the middle of an official hearing? This is the Republic! You are not above the law!
If what I did was illegal, then they can arrest me.
I never said I was.
You'll be fortunate if that's the worst that happens to you.
When I find traitors, I kill them. Period.
Zian got what he deserved.
Don't be ridiculous. You're on Coruscant, not some Outer Rim battlefield--you cannot kill people at will.
Don't talk to me about laws--you break them left and right!
You're a hypocrite.
I've bent the rules many times in my career, certainly--but I've never killed an unarmed public official in the middle of the Senate tower.
You may think you can get away with anything since there's a war on, but don't think there won't be consequences for this.
I'll gladly face the consequences of my actions after we've won.
So be it.
Desperate times call for desperate measures.
We'll see.
You are unbelievable.
Get to your ship and get to Corellia right away. Rakton is in the field--it's an opportunity we can't afford to miss. Garza out.
I'm your ultimate weapon, Garza. There's no one you could send to stop me.
You're all talk.
Enough. That's enough.
I want you on your ship and on your way to Corellia ASAP. Rakton is making his stand--you'll get a full briefing upon arrival. Garza out.
I'm sorry, Major. If I'd known she was so angry, I would've warned you.
It's not your fault, Lieutenant.
No need to apologize.
I know, but I hate to send someone into a situation unprepared.
Garza can rant all she wants. I got the job done.
I don't care if she's angry.
That's what everyone says about you, sir. You get the job done, no matter what.
I shouldn't hold you up anymore. Good luck on Corellia, sir.
I don't like surprises, Lieutenant.
Don't let it happen again.
Of course. I won't hold you up any longer--good luck on your mission to Corellia.
Major--I understand our dilemma has been taken care of. Reports are already circulating about Zian's secondary income.
Rakton could have buried us with this one. If the SIS hadn't come through--if you hadn't convinced the Senate to review their evidence--we would be finished. Well done.
I'm just glad everything worked out.
Thank you.
We were fortunate, there's no doubt about it.
Catching traitors is just standard operating procedure.
All in a day's work.
Hopefully, this will be the last traitor we have to deal with for a long while.
If only I could've gotten that traitor alone for five seconds....
I should've killed Zian.
Let the courts deal with Zian. He isn't our problem anymore.
Join me on Corellia as quickly as possible. General Rakton has taken the field personally--this is the opportunity we've been waiting for.
I'll get Havoc to Corellia on the double, General.
Understood.
I'll give you a detailed briefing after you touch down. Garza out.
What made you decide to go to Corellia yourself, General?
Why are you going in person?
The battle for Corellia may determine the outcome of the entire war, Major. I must take a direct role in commanding our forces.
This could just be another one of his plots.
We'll see.
If so, it's only because we've left him no other options.
Contact me when you arrive, and I'll give you a full briefing. Garza out.
General Rakton! It sounds like you'd better hurry, Major. Good luck!
General Garza--I hadn't expected you here. Or Agent Balkar.
The Senate situation is more complicated than I could explain via holo. I couldn't be certain my office wasn't being monitored.
What I said before was accurate. The Senate has called a hearing to investigate the actions of Special Forces, Havoc Squad specifically.
But what I couldn't say was that the Senator behind these proceedings is actually an undercover agent for the Empire. The entire hearing is a sham.
How could the Empire possibly get an agent elected to the Senate?
That doesn't seem possible.
They didn't. They just bought someone who was already in place.
If this is all nonsense, can I just leave?
Do I still have to go?
This isn't a joking matter.
There's no way one of our Senators is an Imperial spy.
You must be out of your mind.
We have the evidence right here. His name's Zian; he represents a tiny little rock in the middle of some very profitable trade lanes.
With the help of Imperial Intelligence, Senator Zian has slowly gained influence; now, he's turning that influence against us.
It's just another shot from dear old General Rakton. Zian gets Havoc suspended, Rakton gets the break he needs to turn the war back his way.
What's our move? Arrest Zian?
How do we proceed?
Not exactly. The military doesn't have that kind of authority, and detaining Zian would only fuel his accusations that we abuse our power.
We're going to have a hard time convincing anyone of this.
I hope you have good proof.
We've got holorecordings of meetings between Zian and Imperial agents, bank records of the bribes he's gotten--plenty of proof.
You know the problem, you have the proof--you don't need me.
This is wasting my time.
Sham or otherwise, you cannot turn down a Senate summons.
I want you to attend the hearing just as the Senate has asked. We can't risk him getting away. Go and conduct yourself respectfully.
When it's your turn to speak, present the evidence the SIS has gathered. The Senate will have to investigate, and we'll be free to resume operations.
I'll get this cleared up in no time.
Sounds good.
Do we have a backup plan in case the evidence isn't enough?
What if they don't believe me?
The evidence is indisputable. That won't be an issue.
If Senator Zian is a traitor, let's deal with him like one.
I should just take Zian out.
Assassinating public officials, treasonous or otherwise, will only get us removed from duty faster. It's not an option.
Remember: Senator Zian will do his best to paint you as a loose cannon. Don't do anything to prove him right.
I'll be waiting in my office. Report back to me as soon as the hearing is complete. Dismissed.
Have fun, Major.
